    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public <T> Result<T> execute​(Request<T> request)
        Executes a request using an available connection and returns its result. Because a session is auto-closeable but infinitely reusable, this method should be called with the session instance in a try-with-resources block to group related transactions and avoid unhandled commit failures. 
           Session session = new Session(ds);
   try (session) {
     session.execute(new InsertRequest(...));
     session.execute(new DeleteRequest(...));
   } catch (UncheckedSqlException e) {
     session.rollback();
   }
        Type Parameters:
        T - request target type
        Parameters:
        request - database request to execute
        Returns:
        result containing all changed records
        Throws:
        UncheckedSqlException - if a SQL issue occurs

      • rollback

        public void rollback​()
        Rolls back the current transaction.
        Throws:
        UncheckedSqlException - if a SQL issue occurs

      • close

        public void close​()
        Commits buffered transactions and resets the buffer counter.
        Specified by:
